intro: Lomatia praelonga, commonly known as the slender lomatia, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive, finely toothed margin. Lomatia praelonga is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions.
